rComments: Professor Bernier's problem is that her lectures are very confusing : it's full of content that is not necessarily related to the course; unorganized and confusing PP presentations; plus, she speaks a lot and often times forgets what she was saying. I would suggest that you participate during class because she clearly favours those who do it.

The course content was challenging but really interesting. The teacher was very accessible and accommodating to the students' requests. The slides were a bit messy but original, it's a change from the usual! The teacher speaks fast but it's ok. I really liked her!

Though she is a nice lady, it often feels like the readings confuse her more than they confuse the student. She just isn't cut out for lecturing. If possible, take the English section of this class and spare yourself the headache of teaching yourself the course material.

Jai personnellement tout aimer de la dame  jen suis personnellement tombé amoureux  elle a une façon très spéciale daborder les choses quelle sefforce de mettre en contexte avec ce qui se passe dans la vie courante afin de rendre le cours moins historique car cest quand même de la politique au 19 à nos jours. Elle est compréhensive et aide
Elle est une bonne personne , gentile. PAR CONTRE, n'explique pas bien la matiere, elle se perd dans des idées, parle trop vite, et ses cours ne sont pas clairs. avoid her!

No matter what course you take with her, it will be the most stressful during your semester and possibly your entire uni career. Assignments are highly unclear, both on the syllabus and when she explains. The work load is heavy. She seems very nice at the beginning but then stops answering emails and becomes condescending and rude. Try to avoid!

She's super kind, will answer emails, and provide extensions. This course was supposed to be pretty light, but it was not. She assigned a major project that was worth three different marks and did not explain it well; not sure anyone got it. Lectures were long and confusing, and slides were all over the place. All readings were online but were long

This is nicest prof I have ever met. BUT, she made this class SO MUCH HARDER than it had to be. I heard the English version of this course is super easy. So if you need to take POL2556, take it with another prof.

I don't know what she's teaching. I'm not sure she even knows what she's teaching... she sounds like she's trying to explain something for the first time without fully understanding what shes explaining in the first place. How did her lectures make the readings HARDER to understand? Save yourselves.

Her lectures are very long and boring. Shes talks about lots of things during the class which makes it hard to understand and to tell if what she is saying is important. Shes nice prof willing to answers your questions whether if its after class or via email
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Lots of reading. Never catches her points in her lectures... but very helpful and attentive when you ask her questions in person. The exam and assignments are fairly easy.

The teacher is unable to keep the information to the point... She rumbles on a lot of subjects that are not relevant to the class... Showed up to the class just to make the attending points, but really I was listening to video's and reading about the philosopher seen in class because youtube is a better teacher

Not a good prof at all, she rambles so much and talks very fast and it's hard to tell if any of it is actually important. I feel like I've learned literally nothing from her and find listening to her just frustrating because she is so unclear

Not a crim prof teaching a crim class... Always too excited, goes OFF topic every 5 minutes, can stay on 1 slide for 45 minutes, vocab is VERY advanced so its hard to follow and understand. Her final was open book and I still think I managed to fail that. Her slides mostly have pictures and arrows, her readings are SUPER long and not related ?

Very confusing prof, she is all over the place with her lectures and doesn't really know what she is talking about. Criminology is not her background and it shows. Her lectures aren't super relevant to what we are supposed to be learning. Avoid if possible!
She is good when she has a good day or it can be quite confusing when she Is confused. Course was ok. Available outside of her office hours
Amazing person and wonderful professor! Will take more of her classes.
very helpful and full of energy
Lovely woman.

Son niveau de connaissance est impressionnant. La matière comme telle peut être difficile à saisir, mais elle est juste pour les notes. Elle se perd facilement dans la matière. Elle aime interagir avec les étudiants. Je n'aime pas beaucoup les groupes de discussions, mais dans cette classe c'était vraiment intéressant.

One of the best professors I've ever had. She is extremely kind, friendly, and clearly passionate about what she is teaching. She is very knowledgeable and loves to interact with her students in order to get to know them personally. She is a very fair grader and loves to see her students succeed. I'll definitely take more classes with her.

You have to pay attention, you have to read and ready to analyse everything. Classic content, history, philosophy, theology and politic HEAVY. Seems to be knowledgeable but get lost very often in her way of teaching. Don't bring up her research or thesis... read read read and analyse analyse and analyse. GOOD LUCK

I actually really enjoyed the course I took with Mme Bernier. She does get lost in her thoughts sometimes, but I didn't find it affected my understanding of the subject matter. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but I found that my class notes were more helpful than the texts when it came to writing the at-home exams.

She is very passionate and caring. Shes very difficult to follow sometimes though. The lectures are boring. Lots of reading. BUT youre marked on two take home midterms, and a take home final, so if you do the readings, its easy to succeed in the class.

She is a very passionate, interesting and caring teacher, however she sometimes get lost in her own thought making it hard to follow, especially if you are used to Charboneau's strictly organised lectures. Overall she cares about your learning. She also is pretty flexible concerning exams and stuff and very accessible outside of class.

She's not a good professor, in criminology at least. She doesn't know what she's talking about and her thoughts are all over the place, which makes it very hard to keep up with her explanations. She sometimes loses her train of thought and has to restart. Overall, her method of teaching is very sloppy and it's very hard to understand her point.

Mme. Bernier est l'un des cas que j'appel "spéciale"; elle est drôle, énergisante mais n'a aucun sens d'orientation. Elle se perd constamment dans ses idées et à une faiblesse au niveau de ses habiletés de bases/connaissances pour enseigner à une classe de 120. En outre, les ateliers et fiches de lectures sont bien; les examens sont +- faciles.
One of the best prof I had , amazing readings, amazing vibe, she rocks

Everything indicated below about the prof is 100% accurate.. Please follow the suggestions and AVOID this prof. She is extremely unclear and incoherent her sentences make no sense and she always tries to use fancy words for no reason. Her ideas also do not follow each other. The saving graces of this class are the discussion groups and google.

Lovely person who does know what she's talking about. Problem is, she's massively disorganised and her lectures are almost impossible to follow. Her DGDs though, are awesome and very useful - it's good that's there a lot of them. She will also take the time to answer all your questions and does engage with students. Pretty easy class too.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: This teacher is really terrible. She loses herself in her thoughts to the point of being incoherent. Her exams are a poor reflection of what she teaches and often times don't make sense what with poor formulation. I could write a doctorate essay on how terrible she is but I'll leave it at don't take any of her classes. The easy grade isn't worth it

Doesn't matter if it's in French or in English, she just can't teach. She get's lost in her thoughts all the time, can't answer a question and makes you wonder if she even knows about what she is teaching. I must say that she is a very nice person.

Emilie should not teach courses in english. In lectures she often will start a thought or definition and then finish in an entirely different thought. Many times she will "not know the word" or she will "um, um, yes, right" to herself and no one really knows what is going on. She knows what doesn't want in essays but not really what she does want.

Emilie is very nice as a person but if you are taking a class with her in English you may want to avoid it. She also always goes overtime on her lectures, and half the class leaves while she is still speaking. She then lectures the students who stuck around on leaving before she dismisses them. Don't skip class. Do all the readings. No clarity.

Elle donne beaucoup de lecture et elle est difficile à comprendre, car elle a tendance à se perdre dans ses idées. Les sujets vus en classe sont intéressante, c'est la seule raison qui rend ce cours acceptable.

Emilie est très gentille, mais extrêmement difficile à suivre.  On pourrait résumer ses cours à "oh je suis désolé, vous avez bouger dans votre chaise et ça m'a déconcentré" ou "je me suis perdue dans mes idées".  Il est incroyablement difficile de comprendre la matière qu'elle ne semble pas maîtriser elle-même.   Je déconseille fortement.

Emilie is a great Prof! She is there to help you and will change her schedule to meet with you. She is not an easy grader however, you will have to work for your grade. A little confusing in her lectures.

Tres bonne prof! La matiere est un peu complexe mais elle n'hesite pas a simplifier pour les etudiants. Toujours la pour expliquer et vous donner un coup de pouce! Je vais surement reprendre un cours avec elle si l'occasion se presente.

J'avoue que j'aime pas vraiment la philosophie politique mais j'ai trouvé que les sujets discutés dans le cours étaient vraiment tres intéressant. La prof semble passionné et ça se transmet à ses étudiant. Même si les lectures sont longues et difficile.

Elle enseigne tellement mal. Elle s'arrête en pleine phrase et dit "désolé je me suis perdue dans mes mots". Elle répond à tes questions en disant "Ben, qu'est que toi t'en pense?" Et elle donne des examens maisons de 15 pages sur des textes qui ne sont mêmes pas inclus dans le recueil... Évitez à tout prix!!!
